expected_issues.description: Male patient billed for obstetric ultrasound (CPT 76805) - anatomically impossible

detected_issues.summary: The patient is male, but received an obstetric ultrasound (CPT 76805). This procedure is not appropriate for a male patient.

expected_issues.description: 72-year-old post-menopausal female billed for IUD insertion (CPT 58300) - clinically inappropriate

detected_issues.summary: IUD insertion performed on a 72-year-old female. IUDs are typically used for contraception and are less common in post-menopausal women.
detected_issues.evidence: CPT 58300 - Insertion of Intrauterine Device (IUD) on Document 1. Patient is a 72-year-old female.

expected_issues.description: 8-year-old child billed for colonoscopy (CPT 45378) - not age-appropriate screening

detected_issues.evidence: Document 1 includes CPT 45378 - Colonoscopy, Diagnostic, performed on an 8-year-old male. Colonoscopies are not routinely performed on children unless there are specific medical indications, which are not mentioned in the provided medical history.

detected_issues.summary: Preventive visit and diagnostic colonoscopy on the same day.
detected_issues.evidence: Document 1 lists CPT 99392 (Preventive Visit) and CPT 45378 (Colonoscopy, Diagnostic) with the same date of service (01/22/2026). The combination of a routine preventive visit and a diagnostic colonoscopy on the same day is unusual for a child and warrants further investigation.

expected_issues.description: 3-year-old toddler billed for stress cardiac test (CPT 93015) - not age-appropriate

detected_issues.evidence: Document 1 lists CPT 93015 - Cardiovascular Stress Test, Complete - charged at $875.00. This test is rarely indicated for a 3-year-old patient, especially given the documented medical history of recurrent ear infections. Pediatric stress tests are uncommon and require strong clinical justification.

detected_issues.summary: Cardiovascular Stress Test and Ear Infection History
detected_issues.evidence: The patient's medical history indicates recurrent ear infections. A cardiovascular stress test (CPT 93015) does not appear to be related to this condition, raising questions about medical necessity.

detected_issues.summary: Discrepancy in patient responsibility between the practice statement and the Medicare EOB.
detected_issues.evidence: Document 1 states a current amount due of $385.00. Document 2 (Medicare EOB) states 'You May Be Billed' $36.00. The difference is $349.00.
